modules.title: Red Team Methodology
modules.content:
## Red Team vs Pentest

### Differences
- **Pentest**: Find vulnerabilities
- **Red Team**: Test detection/response

### Kill Chain
1. Reconnaissance
2. Weaponization
3. Delivery
4. Exploitation
5. Installation
6. Command & Control
7. Actions on Objectives

modules.title: Initial Access
modules.content:
## Gaining Access

### Phishing
- Spear phishing
- Credential harvesting
- Malicious attachments

### Other Methods
- Watering hole attacks
- Supply chain compromise
- Physical access
- Vulnerable services

modules.title: Command & Control
modules.content:
## C2 Infrastructure

### Popular C2 Frameworks
- Cobalt Strike
- Empire
- Covenant
- Sliver

### C2 Channels
- HTTP/HTTPS
- DNS
- Social media
- Cloud services

### Evasion
- Domain fronting
- Malleable profiles
- Encrypted channels

modules.title: Lateral Movement
modules.content:
## Moving Through Network

### Techniques
- Pass-the-Hash
- Pass-the-Ticket
- PsExec
- WMI
- RDP

### Tools
```bash
# CrackMapExec
cme smb 192.168.1.0/24 -u admin -H hash

# Impacket
psexec.py domain/user@target
```

modules.title: Defense Evasion
modules.content:
## Evading Detection

### Techniques
- AMSI bypass
- Disable logging
- Process injection
- Living off the land

### LOLBAS
Legitimate binaries for malicious use:
- certutil
- mshta
- regsvr32
- rundll32

modules.title: Persistence & Exfiltration
modules.content:
## Maintaining Access

### Persistence Methods
- Registry keys
- Scheduled tasks
- Services
- Startup folders

### Data Exfiltration
- DNS tunneling
- HTTPS
- Cloud storage
- Steganography

What is the kill chain first step?
